00023 //-----------------------------------------------
00024 // Overflow handler for float-to-half conversion;
00025 // generates a hardware floating-point overflow,
00026 // which may be trapped by the operating system.
00027 //-----------------------------------------------
00028 #ifndef NOINLINE
00029 
00030 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
00031         #pragma warning(push)
00032         #pragma warning(disable : 4756)  // Disables 'named type definition in parentheses' warning
00033 #endif
00034 INLINE ILfloat /*ILAPIENTRY*/ ilFloatToHalfOverflow() {
00035         ILfloat f = 1e10;
00036         ILint j;
00037         for (j = 0; j < 10; j++)
00038                 f *= f;                         // this will overflow before
00039         // the for loop terminates
00040         return f;
00041 }
00042 #if defined(_MSC_VER)
00043         #pragma warning(pop)
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 //-----------------------------------------------------
00047 // Float-to-half conversion -- general case, including
00048 // zeroes, denormalized numbers and exponent overflows.
00049 //-----------------------------------------------------
00050 INLINE ILushort ILAPIENTRY ilFloatToHalf(ILuint i) {
00051         //
00052         // Our floating point number, f, is represented by the bit
00053         // pattern in integer i.  Disassemble that bit pattern into
00054         // the sign, s, the exponent, e, and the significand, m.
00055         // Shift s into the position where it will go in in the
00056         // resulting half number.
00057         // Adjust e, accounting for the different exponent bias
00058         // of float and half (127 versus 15).
00059         //
00060 
00061         register int s =  (i >> 16) & 0x00008000;
00062         register int e = ((i >> 23) & 0x000000ff) - (127 - 15);
00063         register int m =   i        & 0x007fffff;
00064 
00065         //
00066         // Now reassemble s, e and m into a half:
00067         //
00068 
00069         if (e <= 0)
00070         {
00071                 if (e < -10)
00072                 {
00073                         //
00074                         // E is less than -10.  The absolute value of f is
00075                         // less than HALF_MIN (f may be a small normalized
00076                         // float, a denormalized float or a zero).
00077                         //
00078                         // We convert f to a half zero.
00079                         //
00080 
00081                         return 0;
00082                 }
00083 
00084                 //
00085                 // E is between -10 and 0.  F is a normalized float,
00086                 // whose magnitude is less than HALF_NRM_MIN.
00087                 //
00088                 // We convert f to a denormalized half.
00089                 // 
00090 
00091                 m = (m | 0x00800000) >> (1 - e);
00092 
00093                 //
00094                 // Round to nearest, round "0.5" up.
00095                 //
00096                 // Rounding may cause the significand to overflow and make
00097                 // our number normalized.  Because of the way a half's bits
00098                 // are laid out, we don't have to treat this case separately;
00099                 // the code below will handle it correctly.
00100                 // 
00101 
00102                 if (m &  0x00001000)
00103                         m += 0x00002000;
00104 
00105                 //
00106                 // Assemble the half from s, e (zero) and m.
00107                 //
00108 
00109                 return s | (m >> 13);
00110         }
00111         else if (e == 0xff - (127 - 15))
00112         {
00113                 if (m == 0)
00114                 {
00115                         //
00116                         // F is an infinity; convert f to a half
00117                         // infinity with the same sign as f.
00118                         //
00119 
00120                         return s | 0x7c00;
00121                 }
00122                 else
00123                 {
00124                         //
00125                         // F is a NAN; we produce a half NAN that preserves
00126                         // the sign bit and the 10 leftmost bits of the
00127                         // significand of f, with one exception: If the 10
00128                         // leftmost bits are all zero, the NAN would turn 
00129                         // into an infinity, so we have to set at least one
00130                         // bit in the significand.
00131                         //
00132 
00133                         m >>= 13;
00134                         return s | 0x7c00 | m | (m == 0);
00135                 }
00136         }
00137         else
00138         {
00139                 //
00140                 // E is greater than zero.  F is a normalized float.
00141                 // We try to convert f to a normalized half.
00142                 //
00143 
00144                 //
00145                 // Round to nearest, round "0.5" up
00146                 //
00147 
00148                 if (m &  0x00001000)
00149                 {
00150                         m += 0x00002000;
00151 
00152                         if (m & 0x00800000)
00153                         {
00154                                 m =  0;         // overflow in significand,
00155                                 e += 1;         // adjust exponent
00156                         }
00157                 }
00158 
00159                 //
00160                 // Handle exponent overflow
00161                 //
00162 
00163                 if (e > 30)
00164                 {
00165                         ilFloatToHalfOverflow();        // Cause a hardware floating point overflow;
00166                         return s | 0x7c00;      // if this returns, the half becomes an
00167                 }                       // infinity with the same sign as f.
00168 
00169                 //
00170                 // Assemble the half from s, e and m.
00171                 //
00172 
00173                 return s | (e << 10) | (m >> 13);
00174         }
00175 }
00176 
00177 // Taken from OpenEXR
00178 INLINE ILuint ILAPIENTRY ilHalfToFloat (ILushort y) {
00179 
00180         int s = (y >> 15) & 0x00000001;
00181         int e = (y >> 10) & 0x0000001f;
00182         int m =  y                & 0x000003ff;
00183 
00184         if (e == 0)
00185         {
00186                 if (m == 0)
00187                 {
00188                         //
00189                         // Plus or minus zero
00190                         //
00191 
00192                         return s << 31;
00193                 }
00194                 else
00195                 {
00196                         //
00197                         // Denormalized number -- renormalize it
00198                         //
00199 
00200                         while (!(m & 0x00000400))
00201                         {
00202                                 m <<= 1;
00203                                 e -=  1;
00204                         }
00205 
00206                         e += 1;
00207                         m &= ~0x00000400;
00208                 }
00209         }
00210         else if (e == 31)
00211         {
00212                 if (m == 0)
00213                 {
00214                         //
00215                         // Positive or negative infinity
00216                         //
00217 
00218                         return (s << 31) | 0x7f800000;
00219                 }
00220                 else
00221                 {
00222                         //
00223                         // Nan -- preserve sign and significand bits
00224                         //
00225 
00226                         return (s << 31) | 0x7f800000 | (m << 13);
00227                 }
00228         }
00229 
00230         //
00231         // Normalized number
00232         //
00233 
00234         e = e + (127 - 15);
00235         m = m << 13;
00236 
00237         //
00238         // Assemble s, e and m.
00239         //
00240 
00241         return (s << 31) | (e << 23) | m;
00242 }
00243 #endif //NOINLINE
00244 
00245 #ifdef _cplusplus
00246 }
00247 #endif
00248 
00249 #endif//MANIP_H
